description: Create a new fine-tuning job, it will be queued for processing.

parameters.description:
* If `true` the job is not spawned, instead the query returns a handful of useful metadata
  for the user to perform sanity checks (see `LegacyJobMetadataOut` response).
* Otherwise, the job is started and the query returns the job ID along with some of the
  input parameters (see `JobOut` response).
parameters.name: dry_run

auto_start.description: This field will be required in a future release.
auto_start.title: Auto Start

anyOf.description: The fine-tuning hyperparameter settings used in a fine-tune job.

learning_rate.description: A parameter describing how much to adjust the pre-trained model's weights in response to the estimated error each time the weights are updated during the fine-tuning process.
learning_rate.title: Learning Rate

training_steps.description: The number of training steps to perform. A training step refers to a single update of the model weights during the fine-tuning process. This update is typically calculated using a batch of samples from the training dataset.
training_steps.title: Training Steps

warmup_fraction.description: (Advanced Usage) A parameter that specifies the percentage of the total training steps at which the learning rate warm-up phase ends. During this phase, the learning rate gradually increases from a small value to the initial learning rate, helping to stabilize the training process and improve convergence. Similar to `pct_start` in [mistral-finetune](https://github.com/mistralai/mistral-finetune)
warmup_fraction.title: Warmup Fraction

weight_decay.description: (Advanced Usage) Weight decay adds a term to the loss function that is proportional to the sum of the squared weights. This term reduces the magnitude of the weights and prevents them from growing too large.
weight_decay.title: Weight Decay

anyOf.title: CompletionTrainingParametersIn

anyOf.description: The fine-tuning hyperparameter settings used in a classifier fine-tune job.

learning_rate.description: A parameter describing how much to adjust the pre-trained model's weights in response to the estimated error each time the weights are updated during the fine-tuning process.
learning_rate.title: Learning Rate

training_steps.description: The number of training steps to perform. A training step refers to a single update of the model weights during the fine-tuning process. This update is typically calculated using a batch of samples from the training dataset.
training_steps.title: Training Steps

warmup_fraction.description: (Advanced Usage) A parameter that specifies the percentage of the total training steps at which the learning rate warm-up phase ends. During this phase, the learning rate gradually increases from a small value to the initial learning rate, helping to stabilize the training process and improve convergence. Similar to `pct_start` in [mistral-finetune](https://github.com/mistralai/mistral-finetune)
warmup_fraction.title: Warmup Fraction

weight_decay.description: (Advanced Usage) Weight decay adds a term to the loss function that is proportional to the sum of the squared weights. This term reduces the magnitude of the weights and prevents them from growing too large.
weight_decay.title: Weight Decay

anyOf.title: ClassifierTrainingParametersIn

api_key.description: The WandB API key to use for authentication.
api_key.title: Api Key

name.description: A display name to set for the run. If not set, will use the job ID as the name.
name.title: Name

project.description: The name of the project that the new run will be created under.
project.title: Project

integrations.description: A list of integrations to enable for your fine-tuning job.
integrations.title: Integrations

model.description: The name of the model to fine-tune.
model.title: FineTuneableModel

suffix.description: A string that will be added to your fine-tuning model name. For example, a suffix of "my-great-model" would produce a model name like `ft:open-mistral-7b:my-great-model:xxx...`
suffix.title: Suffix

validation_files.description: A list containing the IDs of uploaded files that contain validation data. If you provide these files, the data is used to generate validation metrics periodically during fine-tuning. These metrics can be viewed in `checkpoints` when getting the status of a running fine-tuning job. The same data should not be present in both train and validation files.
validation_files.title: Validation Files

created_at.description: The UNIX timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was created.
created_at.title: Created At

fine_tuned_model.description: The name of the fine-tuned model that is being created. The value will be `null` if the fine-tuning job is still running.
fine_tuned_model.title: Fine Tuned Model

name.description: A display name to set for the run. If not set, will use the job ID as the name.
name.title: Name

project.description: The name of the project that the new run will be created under.
project.title: Project

integrations.description: A list of integrations enabled for your fine-tuning job.
integrations.title: Integrations

job_type.description: The type of job (`FT` for fine-tuning).
job_type.title: Job Type

model.description: The name of the model to fine-tune.
model.title: FineTuneableModel

modified_at.description: The UNIX timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was last modified.
modified_at.title: Modified At

object.description: The object type of the fine-tuning job.
object.title: Object

status.description: The current status of the fine-tuning job.
status.title: Status

suffix.description: Optional text/code that adds more context for the model. When given a `prompt` and a `suffix` the model will fill what is between them. When `suffix` is not provided, the model will simply execute completion starting with `prompt`.
suffix.title: Suffix

training_files.description: A list containing the IDs of uploaded files that contain training data.
training_files.title: Training Files

validation_files.description: A list containing the IDs of uploaded files that contain validation data.
validation_files.title: Validation Files

job_type.title: Job Type

status.title: Status

suffix.description: Optional text/code that adds more context for the model. When given a `prompt` and a `suffix` the model will fill what is between them. When `suffix` is not provided, the model will simply execute completion starting with `prompt`.
suffix.title: Suffix

training_files.description: A list containing the IDs of uploaded files that contain training data.
training_files.title: Training Files

validation_files.description: A list containing the IDs of uploaded files that contain validation data.
validation_files.title: Validation Files

cost.description: The cost of the fine-tuning job.
cost.title: Cost

cost_currency.description: The currency used for the fine-tuning job cost.
cost_currency.title: Cost Currency

data_tokens.description: The total number of tokens in the training dataset.
data_tokens.title: Data Tokens

epochs.description: The number of complete passes through the entire training dataset.
epochs.title: Epochs

expected_duration_seconds.description: The approximated time (in seconds) for the fine-tuning process to complete.
expected_duration_seconds.title: Expected Duration Seconds

train_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used during the fine-tuning process.
train_tokens.title: Train Tokens

train_tokens_per_step.description: The number of tokens consumed by one training step.
train_tokens_per_step.title: Train Tokens Per Step

training_steps.description: The number of training steps to perform. A training step refers to a single update of the model weights during the fine-tuning process. This update is typically calculated using a batch of samples from the training dataset.
training_steps.title: Training Steps
